required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Clinical Trial of Hematopoietic Stem Cell Gene Therapy for the Treatment of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy

collaborator.agency: Ospedale San Raffaele - Telethon Institute for Gene Therapy (OSR-TIGET)

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase I/II clinical trial consists of the application of lentiviral vector-based gene therapy to patients affected by Metachromatic Leukodystrophy (MLD), a rare inherited Lysosomal Storage Disorder (LSD) resulting from mutations in the gene encoding the Arylsulfatase A (ARSA) enzyme. The medicinal product consists of autologous CD34+ hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells in which a functional ARSA cDNA is introduced by means of 3rd generation VSV-G pseudotyped lentiviral vectors.

primary_outcome.description: An improvement of 10% of the total GMFM score in treated patients, when compared to the the GMFM scores in the historical control MLD population, evaluated 24 months after treatment.
A significant (≥2 SD) increase of residual ARSA activity as compared to pre- treatment values, measured in PBMC and/or BM progenitors
The absence of engraftment failure or delayed hematopoietic reconstitution (prolonged aplasia), defined as Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC)<500/µl

The absence of regimen related toxicity, as determined by a surveillance of clinical (NCI ≥2) and laboratory (NCI ≥3) parameters that will be applied in the short- and long-term follow-up of the treated patients in order to assess the degree of morbidity associated to the conditioning regimen

primary_outcome.measure: The short-term safety and tolerability of lentiviral-transduced cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated evaluated on the basis of adverse events reporting and monitoring of the systemic reactions to cell infusion

primary_outcome.measure: The long-term safety of lentiviral-transduced cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: Absence of Replication Competent Lentivirus (RCL): ELISA for HIV p24 antigen

secondary_outcome.measure: The absence of immune responses against the transgene
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every three months for the first year, then once a year.
secondary_outcome.description: Even if we do not expect immune responses against the functional ARSA enzyme,

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in the NCV Index for ENG and in the total score for MR
secondary_outcome.description: An improvement in the NCV Index for ENG and in the total score for MR of ≥ 2 SD

Transduced cell engraftment above 4% in PBMCs and CD34+ progenitors in BM. Vector copy number (VCN) per cell in total PBMC, total BM, and peripheral blood (PB) and BM cell subpopulations will also be evaluated.
The measurement of an IQ above 55 (threshold for severe disability) at neuro-psychological testings

arm_group.description: CD34+ cells transduced ex vivo with lentiviral vector encoding ARSA cDNA

intervention.description: Autologous hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells collected from the bone marrow and transduced ex vivo with a Lentiviral vector encoding the human ARSA cDNA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pre-symptomatic MLD patients with the late infantile variant;
- Pre- or early-symptomatic MLD patients with the early juvenile variant;
- Patients for whom parental/guardian signed informed consent has been obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
- HIV RNA and/or HCV RNA and/or HBV DNA positive patients
- Patients affected by neoplastic diseases
- Patients with cytogenetic alterations typical of MDS/AML
- Patients with end-organ functions or any other severe disease which, in the judgment of the investigator, would make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study
- Patients enrolled in other trials.
- Patient who underwent allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in the previous six months.
- Patient who underwent allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation with evidence of residual cells of donor origin.

facility.name: Ospedale San Raffaele - Telethon Institute for Gene Therapy (OSR-TIGET)
